intro: Taraxacum bufonium, commonly known as the yellow hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant belonging to the dandelion family (Compositae). It is characterized by its basal rosette of lanceolate, hairy leaves and produces yellow flowers that develop into elongated, cylindrical seed heads. The plant is native to Europe and is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils. It has a taproot system and is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of environmental conditions. The species is also noted for its medicinal properties, traditionally used in herbal remedies.
